channel.title: Posts on baguettebyte's coding!
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on baguettebyte's coding!

item.title: HTML and CSS: Part 3
item.description:
After the splendid escapade of our inaugural project, we return to the noble halls of HTML and CSS, with a greater emphasis on the ever-dashing CSS this time. I shall be employing CodePen once more, so that both the code and its gallant results may be admired side by side. Now then, let us begin with a touch of general knowledge to set the stage.

CSS, what does it stand for?

It stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

item.title: First Project: Recipes
item.description:
Time for our first project! A celebratory wohoo is in order, progress, dear reader!

We willl now embark upon our maiden voyage into the world of web development with a project graciously provided by The Odin Project, aptly titled Recipes. My humble rendition of this culinary-coded conquest can be found in the following repository on GitHub:

üëâ first-project-recipes

Let the feast of learning commence! üçΩÔ∏è

What we are making

We shall be constructing a modest site consisting of a landing page and a single sub-page. Nothing overly ornate, mind you, but it shall proudly display the knowledge we’ve acquired thus far. From here on out, the only direction is upward.

item.title: HTML and CSS: Part 2
item.description:
Now that we’ve had a delightful dabble with some of the more common tags, assuming, of course, you took a gentlemanly stroll through that most enlightening site I mentioned in Part 1, you should now possess a modest grasp of the basics. Fret not, dear reader, for one is certainly not expected to commit them all to memory at once. At least, I jolly well hope not, heh.

I’ve just breezed through a handful of intriguing little bits I’d like to shine a monocle on today: !DOCTYPE, class, id, alt, and how to properly assemble a humble “skeleton” page, the barebones of a noble web endeavour.

item.title: HTML and CSS: Part 1
item.description:
Prepare to dissect and unravel the mysteries of these fine entities, HTML and CSS. What are they? What marvels might they offer? Why have they appeared, and do they come in peace, or bearing some secret agenda? So fasten your cravat and steady your monocle, for the journey ahead promises to be delightfully turbulent!

What, Pray Tell, Is This Elusive HTML?

Imagine your own body, your skeleton is the HTML, the very foundation that holds everything together. It stands for Hypertext Markup Language, so let’s get hyper indeed.

item.title: Visual Studio Code And Command Line Basics
item.description:
A Gentleman‚Äôs Introduction to Visual Studio Code and the Command Line: Mastering the Tools of the Trade.

So, today’s learning curve brings us face-to-face with the enigmatic realm of IDEs‚Ä¶ or is it IDE’s? No, no, let us avoid that grammatical minefield and simply stick to the singular: IDE. I won’t lie, I have dabbled in Visual Studio Code, or VSC, as the fashionable youth call it, mostly to wrangle this very blog into submission. It was a harrowing ordeal, given my complete lack of expertise, but I persevered! Of course, I leaned heavily on the wisdom of the theme’s discussion board and scoured Hugo’s official site for guidance. A humbling experience, to be sure.

item.title: Taking the First Step: Part 2
item.description:
Beginner’s Guide to the Internet, Web Pages, and Networking: 2

The Continuation from Part 1 ‚Äì Brace Yourselves!

What is a client?

A client, is none other than your trusty computer! The very machine you are using at this moment is connected to your Wi-Fi, which, in turn, is connected to the great expanse of the internet. But let us not forget, software can be clients too! Your web browser, for instance, is a client, politely requesting information from servers so that you may peruse the wonders of the web.

item.title: Taking the first Step: Part 1
item.description:
Beginner’s Guide to the Internet, Web Pages, and Networking: 1

First things first! We shall dive headlong into the vast and mysterious world of the INTERNET. You might gasp in astonishment, “But surely, we already know it all, right?” To which I shall reply, with all due respect, “Absolutely not!” Brace yourselves, my dear friends!

As so graciously explained in this video (oh, how delightful!), the internet is, wait for it, a cable! Yes, I hear your cries of disbelief! “A cable?!” you exclaim, to which I say, “Indeed, let us dig a hole, metaphorically speaking, and uncover the hidden wonders of this humble wire!”

item.title: Welcome!
item.description:
My Launchpad: A Journey from Beginner to Master!

Well, hello there, dear reader! If you‚Äôve stumbled upon this humble corner of the internet, you‚Äôre in for an exciting ride, because we‚Äôre about to dive into the world of coding together. Now, let me be clear: I‚Äôm not a seasoned expert (yet!). I‚Äôm starting this journey from scratch, and I‚Äôm inviting you to join me as I learn, stumble, and hopefully grow into a coding master along the way.
